intro: Homeria brachygyne, commonly known as the narrow-fruit homeria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Homeria brachygyne is often found in humid, lowland areas and is adapted to thrive in shaded environments.
